::: {.cell}

:::

### Version history

This page provides information about older or alternative versions of  indicative distribution map for this ecosystem functional group [**{{< meta params.efgname >}}**](/efg-info/F1_2.qmd).
Check the current maps [here](/map-info/F1_2_valid.qmd).

- Indicative Map (**code: F1.2.IM.alt**, version v2.0) discarded 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.2.web.grid**, version v1.0) duplicated 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.2.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) in preparation 
 - Indicative Map (**code: F1.2.IM.orig**, version v1.0) discarded 
 - Indicative Map (**code: F1.2.IM.mix**, version v1.0) discarded 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.2.web.orig**, version v1.0) requires review 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.2.web.mix**, version v1.0) requires review 

### Datasets

Datasets considered for previous versions of the indicative map

- **FEOW-2008** (Abell et al. 2008).
 - **GIRES-v1.0** (Messager et al. 2021).
 - **GloRIC-1.0** (Ouellet Dallaire et al. 2018).
 - **GSW-1.1** (Pekel et al. 2016).
 - **HydroAtlas-1.0** (Linke et al. 2019).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset        |url                                                                                                                                                                           |
|:--------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|FEOW-2008      |<https://www.feow.org/>{target='links'} :: <https://geospatial.tnc.org/datasets/38da4656e8074e1c820c42cc21cd76cd_0>{target='links'}                                           |
|GIRES-v1.0     |<https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.14633022.v1>{target='links'} :: <http://messamat.github.io/globalirmap/>{target='links'}                                                 |
|GSW-1.1        |<https://global-surface-water.appspot.com/download>{target='links'} :: <https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/JRC_GSW1_1_YearlyHistory>{target='links'} |
|GloRIC-1.0     |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/gloric>{target='links'}                                                                                                                      |
|HydroAtlas-1.0 |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/hydroatlas>{target='links'}                                                                                                                  |


:::
:::

### Available files

You can download geospatial data for older versions of these maps from the following sources:

**F1.2.web.grid** (v1.0): [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.F1_2_web_grid){target="gisdata"}

**F1.2.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958622){target="gisdata"}

**F1.2.web.orig** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/F1.2.web.orig_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

**F1.2.web.mix** (v1.0): [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.F1_2_web_mix){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

But see details of dataset licenses below:

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

|:--------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|FEOW-2008      |https://www.feow.org/copyright :: custom license :: non commercial use                                                                                                    |
|GIRES-v1.0     |https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/                                                                                                                              |
|GSW-1.1        |produced under the Copernicus Programme and is provided free of charge, without restriction of use :: Copernicus Regulation :: http://www.copernicus.eu/main/data-access/ |
|GloRIC-1.0     |freely available for scientific; educational and commercial use :: https://data.hydrosheds.org/file/technical-documentation/HydroSHEDS_TechDoc_v1_4.pdf                   |
|HydroAtlas-1.0 |http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ :: Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 International License                                                             |


:::
:::

## References

References used in these versions of the maps.

- Ouellet Dallaire, C., Lehner, B., Sayre, R., Thieme, M. (2018): *A multidisciplinary framework to derive global river reach classifications at high spatial resolution*. **Environmental Research Letters** 14: 024003. DOI: [10.1088/1748-9326/aad8e9](https://doi.org/10.1088/1748-9326/aad8e9) 
 - Linke, S., Lehner, B., Ouellet Dallaire, C., Ariwi, J., Grill, G., Anand, M., Beames, P., Burchard-Levine, V., Maxwell, S., Moidu, H., Tan, F., Thieme, M.  (2019) *Global hydro-environmental sub-basin and river reach characteristics at high spatial resolution* **Scientific Data** 6: 283 [DOI:10.1038/s41597-019-0300-6](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/s41597-019-0300-6) 
 - Abell R, Thieme ML, Revenga C, Bryer M, Kottelat M, Bogutskaya N, Coad B, Mandrak N, Contreras Balderas S, Bussing W, Stiassny MLJ, Skelton P, Allen GR, Unmack P, Naseka A, Ng R, Sindorf N, Robertson J, Armijo E, Higgins JV, Heibel TJ, Wikramanayake E, Olson D, López HL, Reis RE, Lundberg JG, Sabaj Pérez MH, Petry P (2008) *Freshwater ecoregions of the world: A new map of biogeographic units for freshwater biodiversity conservation*, **BioScience** 58: 403–414. DOI:[10.1641/B580507](https://doi.org/10.1641/B580507) 
 - Messager, M. L., Lehner, B., Cockburn, C., Lamouroux, N., Pella, H., Snelder, T., Tockner, K., Trautmann, T., Watt, C. & Datry, T. (2021) *Global prevalence of non-perennial rivers and streams* **Nature**  [DOI:10.1038/s41586-021-03565-5](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/s41586-021-03565-5) 
 - Pekel JF, Cottam A, Gorelick N, Belward AS (2016) *High-resolution mapping of global surface water and its long-term changes* **Nature** 540, 418-422 [DOI:10.1038/nature20584](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature20584)
